page.title: 01STOPSLEY
page.content: From being a small farming village situated about 8 km north-east of Luton, Stopsley ( still referred to by older inhabitants as a{village})has grown into a fairly large suburb of the town. Although Stopsley has grown immensely in the last fifty years it has not attracted industrial development and has remained a residential area. Stopsley contains shops, churches, public houses,a large Regional Sports Centre, Fire Station and other local ammenities. People interviewed would prefer a greater variety of shops. The old Manor House of Putteridgebury has been converted into a Management College. There is plenty of open parkland, playing fields and farmland which give five views of the town, making Stopsley an attractive area in which to live.
